title: Very slow on CPU
body_html:
my model was really slow with pytorch so I tried one of your examples and saw it is slow as well (seq2seq).

It takes a long time...:
27m 55s (- 390m 53s) (5000 6%) 2.8939
56m 31s (- 367m 27s) (10000 13%) 2.3238
85m 20s (- 341m 23s) (15000 20%) 2.0054
117m 23s (- 322m 50s) (20000 26%) 1.7787
146m 48s (- 293m 36s) (25000 33%) 1.5661

I’m running only on CPU
I’m working on Ubuntu 16.04.3.
64 cores.
Python 3.6.3 :: Anaconda custom (64-bit).

tried using MKL (installed via conda)
didn't help.

Any ideas?

body:
my model was really slow with pytorch so I tried one of your examples and saw it is slow as well ([seq2seq](http://pytorch.org/tutorials/intermediate/seq2seq_translation_tutorial.html)).

It takes a long time...:
27m 55s (- 390m 53s) (5000 6%) 2.8939
56m 31s (- 367m 27s) (10000 13%) 2.3238
85m 20s (- 341m 23s) (15000 20%) 2.0054
117m 23s (- 322m 50s) (20000 26%) 1.7787
146m 48s (- 293m 36s) (25000 33%) 1.5661

I’m running only on CPU
I’m working on Ubuntu 16.04.3.
64 cores.
Python 3.6.3 :: Anaconda custom (64-bit).

tried using MKL (installed via conda)
didn't help.

Any ideas?
